text: The standard atmosphere (symbol: atm) is a unit of atmospheric pressure. It refers to the air pressure at sea level and is defined as equal to 101,325 Pa.BIPM Definition of the standard atmosphere Since 1982, it has been replaced by the bar, which is exactly 105 Pa.IUPAC.org, Gold Book, Standard Pressure The use of either unit is discouraged. == Related pages== *Standard temperature and pressure == References == Category:Units of pressure
title: Atmosphere (unit)
